revision.text:
{{Infobox military person|name = Pavel Andreyevich Mironov|native_name = Павел Андреевич Миронов|birth_date = 12 December 1919|birth_place = Russkiye Sarsazy village, [[Chistopolsky Uyezd]], [[Kazan Governorate]], [[Russian Empire]]|death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|1945|04|26|1919|12|12}}|death_place = northwest of [[Brno]], [[South Moravia]], [[Czechoslovakia]]|allegiance = {{flag|Soviet Union}}|branch = [[Red Army]]|rank = [[Junior lieutenant]]|serviceyears = 1939-1945|unit = [[8th Guards Cavalry Division]]|battles = [[World War II]] *[[Bratislava–Brno Offensive]]|awards = {{Hero of the Soviet Union}}{{Order of Lenin}} [[Order of the Patriotic War]] 2nd class|image = Pavel Andreyevich Mironov.jpg}}'''Pavel Andreyevich Mironov''' ({{Lang-ru|Павел Андреевич Миронов}}; 12 December 1919 – 26 April 1945) was a [[Red Army]] [[Junior Lieutenant]] and a posthumous [[Hero of the Soviet Union]]. Mironov was awarded the title [[Hero of the Soviet Union]] and the [[Order of Lenin]] for actions during the [[Bratislava–Brno Offensive|Bratislava-Brno Offensive]].<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|title = Миронов Павел Андреевич|url = http://www.warheroes.ru/hero/hero.asp?Hero_id=11689|website = www.warheroes.ru|accessdate = 2015-11-14|trans-title = Pavel Andreyevich Mironov|language = Russian|last = Kargopoltsev|publisher = |first = Sergei}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book|title = Герои Советского Союза. Т. 2: Любовь - Ящук|url = https://books.google.com/books?id=T85BAAAAYAAJ|publisher = Voenizdat|date = 1988|isbn = 9785203005366|language = ru|first = I.|last = Shkadov|trans-title = Heroes of the Soviet Union|volume = 2}}</ref>
== Early life == Pavel Andreyevich Mironov was born on 12 December 1919 in the village of Russkiye Sarsazy in [[Chistopolsky Uyezd]] of [[Kazan Governorate]] to a family of peasants. He graduated from seven classes and the factory training school in [[Chistopol]]. Mironov worked as an assistant mechanic with the [[Kama River Shipping Company]].<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1">{{Cite web|title = МИРОНОВ Павел Андреевич (12.11.1919—26.4.1945)|url = http://tatfrontu.ru/content/mironov-pavel-andreevich-12111919-2641945|website = Virtual Museum of the Great Patriotic War of the Republic of Tatarstan|accessdate = 2015-11-14|trans-title = Pavel Andreyevich Mironov|language = Russian}}</ref><ref name=":2">{{Cite web|title = Библиотека - Люди и книги|url = http://www.az-libr.ru/index.htm?Persons&C8G/5313f98a/index|website = www.az-libr.ru|accessdate = 2015-11-14|trans-title = Pavel Andreyevich Mironov|date = |language = Russian}}</ref>
== World War II == In October 1939, Mironov was drafted into the [[Red Army]]. In 1942, he was in combat and graduated from the junior lieutenant's courses. By April 1945, Mironov was an anti-tank gun platoon commander in the [[33rd Guards Cavalry Regiment]] of the [[8th Guards Cavalry Division]]. He fought in the [[Bratislava–Brno Offensive]]. On 26 April 1945, northwest of [[Brno]], his platoon reportedly destroyed a tank, four armored personnel carriers and two artillery pieces.<ref name=":1" /> Reportedly, they also killed 50 German soldiers with machine guns. Mironov was killed during this action and was buried in the [[Brno Central Cemetery]]. He was awarded the [[Order of the Patriotic War]] 2nd class on 23 May.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Память народа :: Документ о награде :: Миронов Павел Андреевич, Орден Отечественной войны II степени|url = https://pamyat-naroda.ru/heroes/podvig-chelovek_nagrazhdenie42619469/|website = pamyat-naroda.ru|accessdate = 2015-11-14}}</ref> On 15 May 1946, he was awarded the title [[Hero of the Soviet Union]] and the [[Order of Lenin]].<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":2" /><ref>{{Cite web|title = Память народа :: Документ о награде :: Миронов Павел Андреевич, Герой Советского Союза (Орден Ленина и медаль "Золотая звезда")|url = https://pamyat-naroda.ru/heroes/podvig-chelovek_nagrazhdenie150021506/|website = pamyat-naroda.ru|accessdate = 2015-11-14}}</ref>
== Legacy == A street in [[Chistopol]]<ref name=":1" /> and a ship of the Kama River Shipping Company are named after Mironov.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":2" />
== References == <references />
